Jeff Spicoli.Action: Shows up late to class, wet hair, red eyes, seemingly stoned but still confirms he is registered for the class with a grin.
Arrives late to class, appearing disheveled and clearly under the influence.
Answers Mr. Hand that he is registered for the class despite poor timing and appearance.
Laughs at Mr. Hand's lonely comment and tries to engage positively despite tension.
Calls Mr. Hand 'dick' after his card is torn, showing frustration but honest reaction.
Attempts to clarify his presence and be part of class by asking to come in politely.
Fails to recognize the seriousness of the situation and is late to class, showing confusion about the schedule.
Attempts to enter class showing some awareness of his schedule but lacks proper preparation or confidence.
Expresses disbelief and challenges authority after having his red ad card torn up, but fails to de-escalate or respond constructively.
Fishes a few bits of his ad card out of the wastebasket and huffs out of the room.
Comes out of the bathroom surrounded by stoners, involved in marijuana smoking.
Verbally stands up to Mr. Hand by calling him a dick after having his ad card ripped up.
Rips up another student's class notes in retaliation and calls him a dick.
Jokes with friends and casually asks for a dollar, showing relaxed social interaction.
Rips up another student's class notes in retaliation and confidently tells his friends to expect consequences if hassled again.
Expresses surprise and lightheartedness when found for truancy, jokingly says 'There's no birthday party for me here!'
Is truant and late to class, which causes disruption and shows disregard for rules
Is repeatedly truant and late to class, fails to prioritize attendance and punctuality.
Honest about his reason for being late (food lines took forever), showing some awareness of the situation.
Responds honestly and simply 'I don't know' to Mr. Hand's reprimand instead of making excuses or lying.
Stays after class when all other students have left, seemingly preparing a comeback but respectfully accepts Mr. Hand's interruption and leaves without confrontation.
Works the studio audience into a frenzy while confidently singing and performing on live TV.
Uses humor and charm to deflect concern about his red eyes with a famous, well-received line.
Casually admits plans to pick up hash and go to the mountains, revealing a lack of seriousness.
Dismissively explains school as no problem by attending only half the time, reflecting a careless attitude toward responsibilities.
Shares his surfing film clip with an audience, speaks with enthusiasm and humor.
Mentions his little brother interrupting his moment, showing family connection despite distractions.
Throws snorkel at little brother Curtis, causing him to cry.
Groans and tells Curtis to leave him alone when woken up.
Reluctantly gets out of bed and shuts the door on Curtis after conflict.
Throws a snorkel at his little brother in a half-hearted attempt to fend him off, missing completely.
Struggles to get out of bed and repeatedly groans and complains.
Arrives late and stumbles into a mandatory school assembly, taking a seat quietly.
Surrounded by young surfers who listen to him with reverence, gives enthusiastic advice on Missile Command reflecting a friendly and engaging demeanor.
Gives strategic advice about playing Missile Command, explaining the importance of being proactive in the game.
Surrounded by young surfers who listen with reverence, indicating confidence and informal leadership.
Smokes grass and drinks beer with L.C., shows casual tolerance and relaxed friendliness in interaction.
Speeds recklessly in a borrowed car, ignoring potential consequences.
Warns L.C. about possible police, looking out for his companion's safety.
Dismisses L.C.'s concern about hassling the car, showing complacency about property respect.
Notices a potential police car behind him and slows down, exhibiting awareness of surroundings.
Speeds recklessly in a car that is not his, while smoking and drinking, showing poor judgment.
Engages in casual conversation and seems laid back despite risky behavior, indicating low urgency or concern for consequences.
Calls the opposing drivers 'Jocks' and competes aggressively by speeding up to overtake them.
Asks L.C. to roll up his window because the air messes his hair, showing some self-centeredness.
Smiles wickedly at L.C. after overtaking the Granada, indicating a playful but somewhat provocative attitude.
Tries to make a clever hairpin turn to get back to the party, but accidentally crashes the car.
Immediately asks L.C. if he is okay after the crash, showing concern for his companion.
Reassures L.C. after accident, tries to calm his fears with humor and optimism.
Insists he can fix the badly damaged car, encouraging a positive outlook.
Tries to reassure L.C. by saying he can fix the badly damaged car, citing his father's profession and tools.
Sits bright and clear-eyed in class with textbook open to the proper page, appearing attentive and prepared.
Orders pizza to be delivered to the classroom, interrupting the lesson and causing a disturbance.
Pays the delivery man generously and politely, showing social grace and confidence.
Responds coolly and urbane to Mr. Hand's reprimand, attempting to maintain composure.
Orders a pizza and tries to share it with the passing stoners despite getting in trouble with Mr. Hand.
Mockingly calls the stoners 'swine' after giving them the pizza.
Attempts to lighten the mood by ordering pizza during class time, showing a carefree and relaxed attitude.
Ignores consequences and accepts detention with a shrug, indicating low responsibility.
Engages in behavior that irritates authority (Mr. Hand) and disrupts class, showing poor judgment.
Asks to use the bathroom politely despite the sign indicating 'Employees Only', but then gets confused trying to find it, needing multiple clarifications.
Interrupts a tense robbery scene by casually coming out of the bathroom, unintentionally providing Brad with a distraction to act against the robber.
Stands mesmerized and compliments Brad's bravery by saying 'Awesome. Totally awesome.'
Interrupts the armed robbery scene by casually walking out of the bathroom, unintentionally distracting the robber.
Merely stands mesmerized and comments 'Awesome. Totally awesome' instead of taking an active role in resolving the crisis.
Attempts to tie a tie but is distracted and takes a hit from his bong instead of focusing.
His room is messy and clothes lie in disarray, indicating lack of personal organization.
Displays irritation at little brother Curtis for bursting in without knocking, telling him to go away.
Allows Mr. Hand into his room after an initial surprised reaction and nods in response, showing respectful acknowledgment.
Responds politely to Mr. Hand's reprimand with mild uncertainty ('Did I do something wrong, Mr. Hand?').
Passively accepts Mr. Hand's instructions to sit on the bed ('I don't know. I guess so.').
Admits honestly that the book is in his locker when asked to turn to a chapter.
Shows unawareness and forgetfulness about bringing textbook to class (textbook is in locker, not with him).
Comes to Mr. Hand's room when called, agrees to have a serious conversation despite awkwardness.
Smiles warmly and jokes with Mr. Hand after a tense study session, extends his hand in a friendly gesture, and uses a casual, positive farewell.
Asks Mr. Hand if he is a 'guy like me every year' in a somewhat self-deprecating but sincere way, showing vulnerability.
Panics briefly when threatened with failure but quickly recovers enthusiasm, showing openness and trust in Mr. Hand's judgment.
Attempts to grasp and understand difficult material (U.S. history) despite apparent struggle.
Misunderstands or oversimplifies the historical point he is trying to make.
Asks Mr. Hand sincere questions about his role as a student, showing some self-awareness.
Expresses overconfidence by declaring he won't come back to history class, despite uncertain chances to graduate.
Shows panic and concern when faced with possibility of failure, indicating some level of investment.
Asks a friend to sign his annual in a casual, playful way and ends up causing discomfort by slipping the book into the friend's crotch.
Has an annual filled mostly with drug-related messages and signatures, indicating a lack of serious social or academic engagement.
Greets his stoner bud enthusiastically, showing friendly and relaxed demeanor.
Warns a young buzz-cut kid with 'Hey, bud! Watch yourself!'
Avoids confrontation and runs away when confronted by Lincoln Surf Nazis instead of escalating conflict.
Confidently declares 'Summer, mon! We're there!' showing enthusiasm and some spontaneity.
Accidentally bumps into a young buzz-cut kid while moving backwards, showing poor spatial awareness.
Faces the group of eight hostile Surf Nazis with apparent calm but does not confront them intellectually or physically.
Dashes off to escape Surf Nazis, successfully evading capture and never getting caught.
